CameraLink for Gray-Scale Cameras in Medium Configuration

Parameter Set
.

Description
..

The feature CameraLink enables the adaptation of the hardware applet to the data format delivered by your camera.

To receive correct image data from your camera it is crucial, that the camera output format matches the selected framegrabber input format. Most cameras support different opperation modes. Please, consult the manual of your camera to obtain the nescesary information, how to configure the camera to the desired data format.


Parameters
.

Input Format

Since the choice of the Applet already determines whether the medium camera format is gray or color, the Input Format parameter gives only options for the amount of bits per pixel.

For gray cameras the following options are available:

Input Format
(Camera Format)		 Valid Bits/Pixel
(internally)		 Output Format
  [Bit/Pixel] [Bit/Pixel]
8 bit/pixel, 4 tap 8 8 (or 16)
10 bit/pixel, 4 tap 10 8 or 16
12 biT/pixel, 4 tap 12 8 or 16

The output format of your frame grabber can be selected indepently from the input format.

To receive correct image data from your camera it is crucial, that the camera output format matches the selected frame grabber input format. Most cameras support different opperation modes. Please, consult the manual of your camera to obtain the nescesary information, how to configure the camera to the desired data format.

Output Format

For gray cameras there are two options for the output format. Either 8bit/pixel, or 16bit/pixel are transefered through the PCI bus into the frame buffer of your PC. The output format of your frame grabber can be selected indepently from the input format from the camera.

To safe bandwidth at the PCI bus it might be desirable to use a 8bit/pixel output mode, even in conjuction with a camera delivering more than 8bits/pixel. The Knee Lookup Table could make this a satisfying option, since it is possible to map a 10bit/pixel input non-linearily to a 8bit/pixel output -- map only desired information to 8bit/pixel.

Use DVAL

By default this parameter is set to "Yes" and shouldn't be changed, but the frame grabber constantly times out or is grabbing partial lines.

Some rare cameras do not comply to the CameraLink standard and keep the "DVAL"-signal constantly low, even while transmitting valid data. In this case you could try to set the parameter to "NO".

Pixel Depth

The pixel depth delivers the information of the number of valid bits/pixel. E.g. when using a 10bit/pixel camera and a 16bit/pixel output format with right-alignment, then Pixel Depth=10 to indicate that the lower 10bit of the 16bit value cover the pixel.

The pixel depth parameter can't be changed manually.
.
